column4: I have MySQL Server 4.1 installed on this machine, but am unable to start it. Can any one help?
What is the output of sudo /etc/init.d/mysql start
I get a message saying, "sudo: /etc/init.d/mysql: command not found"
How exactly did you install mysql?
Done that and still get the same message
pdroy80: Yea, was about to suggest that next :) do sudo dpkg -l mysql-server
So you didn't actually install mysql :)
How should have I installed it?
I would have just done sudo apt-get install mysql-server though that will pull down 5.0
I have "MySQL Tutorial" book and it expects users to have 4.1 installed
Well, I would either just sudo apt-get install mysql-server and count on most of the stuff still working, or you're going to have to download the source for 4.1 and compile it yourself
If it were me, I'd just grab mysql-server
